CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 6, 1969, pg. 6, reads: "Organize Black Catholic Knights - Officers of Council 157, Knights of St. Peter Claver, which was organized at St. Brigid's-St. Benedict The Moor Church on a recent Sunday morning, and those who conducted the Installation Rites are pictured above.  Among those in left photo, reading from left are: Bill Long, trustee of the new council; Leo Evans, inner guard; Dr. Earl Belle Smith, fourth degree Knight of St. Gregory; Father John LaBauve, now of Louisiana, assistant National Chaplain; Martin Davis, treasurer; Willie Kelley of Chicago, Ill., district deputy of Northern States; Msgr. Paul Bassompierre, pastor; Shields Gilmore, of New Orleans, La., National Supreme Knight and Franklin Jerry of Pittsburgh, Grand Knight of the newly organized council...-Harris Photo."image published by New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, with Bishop Vincent Leonard and unknown man wearing double breasted suit masked; addition of Earl Belle Smith, Father John LaBauve, Willie Kelley, Shields Gilmore, and Franklin Jerry from negative 2001.35.15825.
TitMainTitle: Knights of St. Peter Claver officers, from left: Bill Long, Leo Evans, Martin Davis, Bishop Vincent Leonard, three unknown men, and Msgr. Paul Bassompierre, posed in St. Brigid's - St. Benedict the Moor Church
